com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.GuardedCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SmartCommands.GuardedDialogInterfaceClickListener, SmartCommands.GuardedViewClickListener, SmartCommands.ProgressGuardedCommand, SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommmand
Enclosing class:
SmartCommands
public abstract static class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A Runnable which is allowed to throw an exception during its execution.

During the command execution, any thrown Throwable will be delivered to the ActivityController through its ActivityController.handleException(Context, Throwable) method, so that it can be controller in a central way, and not "swallowed".

It has been specifically designed for being able to run Runnable which throw exceptions within the SmartCommands.SmartThreadPoolExecutor.

Since:
2010.06.08

Method Detail

getContext

protected final android.content.Context getContext()
Returns:
the activity which will be used for reporting a potential exception

runGuarded

protected abstract void runGuarded()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
The body of the command execution.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - the method allows an exception to be thrown, and will be appropriately caught by the ActivityController#handleException(Activity, Throwable) method

handle

protected java.lang.Throwable handle(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
A fallback method which will be triggered if a Throwable is thrown during the runGuarded() method, so as to let the caller a chance to handle locally the exception.

By default, the method does nothing and returns the provided throwable.

Parameters:
throwable - the exception that has been thrown during the runGuarded() execution
Returns:
null if and only if the method has handled the exception and that the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler should not be invoked ; otherwise, the Throwable that should be submitted to the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

run

public final void run()
This method will invoke the runGuarded() method, and handle any thrown exception.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
